texto: Fibra Educa presents its 2024 Sustainability Report, in which it reaffirms its commitment to long-term value creation through the sustainable management of its educational real estate platform.
Fibra Educa promotes the energy transition at the Instituto Patria Mérida with the commissioning of its photovoltaic system.

On January 21, the University of Ecatepec inaugurated a photovoltaic system with an installed capacity of 19.31 kWp. Fibra Educa now has five interconnected photovoltaic systems and is moving towards a cleaner, more profitable and efficient future.

UNIDEP Tijuana started up its new photovoltaic system, composed of 161 solar panels and with an installed capacity of 94.18 kWp. This advance will allow the building's electricity consumption to be supplied with renewable energy, significantly reducing its carbon footprint.
Instituto Patria Mérida obtains EDGE Advanced certification and consolidates its position as a benchmark for sustainability
Our portfolio continues to grow in sustainability: UNE receives EDGE Advanced certification
Raúl Martínez Solares, CEO of Fibra Educa, participates in the panel ‘Beyond profits: how CEOs drive corporate sustainability’ as part of the Santander Sustainable 2024 event.
Fibra Educa property wins 3rd place in the sustainable category of the GRI Awards Mexico 2024
Fundación Fibra Educa recognizes the best students of the first generation of graduates
Two Fibra Educa properties are nominated in the category of "best sustainable project" by GRI
Graduation of the first generation of graduates of the Fibra Educa Foundation.
Fibra Educa receives annual recognition for 50/50 as an entity with 3 or more independent female directors on its board of directors.

Fibra Educa concludes the reopening of its sustainability-linked bonds on the Mexican Stock Exchange for a total of $3,983 million pesos. This action completes its Certificados Bursatiles Fiduciarios program, reaching a total of $7,722 million pesos
Fibra Educa starts up its first photovoltaic system with an installed capacity of 58 Kwp, with which we will be able to power up to 100% of the operations of our building in Culiacán, Sinaloa.
Fibra Educa celebrates its sixth anniversary on Fibra Educa Day 2024
Raúl Martinez Solares participates as moderator in the panel “Rutas de acceso a FIBRAs a través del mercado financiero” during the #ConectaFIBRA organized by AMEFIBRA.
Raúl Martínez Solares participated in the panel “Capital Markets to Promote Development” at the Latin America GRI Real Estate 2024.
Fibra Educa contributes to the financing of more than $300 billion pesos through thematic bonds on the Mexican Stock Exchange.
